main.name: Caroline Danson
main.description: After quite a few years in social work I changed my carrier path to work with my passion - IT. I have mainly worked with Java, ReactJs, Javascript and Flutter
main.bio: So who am I? I’m a positive, analytical and curious person originating from the north of Sweden. I love to take on new challenges and learn new things! I have for several years worked as a social worker but have now re-educated myself to be able to work within the IT-industry. I have experience both with backend development in Java and frontend development in Javascript, ReactJs, CSS, HTML and Flutter. I’m a certified Scrum Master(PSM I). I enjoy solving complex problems, and working in teams, whilst having fun along the way. Scroll down to see more about me and things I'm working on or have worked with!
main.contactmessage: I would love to hear from you! Maybe you have an exciting project, a job opportunity or a role where we could be colleagues? If you wish to get in touch, you can contact me

resume.skillmessage: An overview of my technology skills.

education.school: Academy, a part of Academic Work AB
education.description: I have completed Academy’s Accelerated Learning Program in Java. Accelerated Learning is a fast way to a new career for ambitious and driven individuals with the right skills to acquire new knowledge. The education method focuses on high-speed practical learning, agile teamwork and continuous feedback dialogue. The education includes around 500 hours of coding and is always based on specific tasks relevant to the professional role. This makes the learning process extremely efficient and therefore I can contribute as junior developer from the first day after training. During the education the focus was mainly Java, but also technologies such as object oriented programming, Spring Framework, SQL Databases, HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Scrum, Git, UX, TDD and intro to AWS.

During my bachelor of science in social work I have studied subjects such as sociology, psychology, social policies and law. I have also been educated in ways to cooperate in teams and the ability to reflect in a systematic way. My bachelor thesis was based in England. The thesis focused on the use of modern technology when working with people with dementia.

education.degree: Complete Flutter App Development Bootcamp with Dart
education.description: This course was officially created in collaboration with the Google Flutter team. During the course I learnt to code using Dart and build beautiful, fast, native-quality iOS and Android apps. Furthermore I build around 15 apps during the course.

work.title: IT-consultant
work.description: After finished education in Java at Academy I started to work as an IT-consultant at Academic Work. Unfortunately due to Covid-19, they were not able to place me at a client.

work.title: Investigative social worker, counsellor, Social work consultant
work.description: After graduating from Lund University in 2011, I have worked at several different councils as a social worker and have gained many years of experience within the public sector. I have had various roles such as investigator at the social services, as a social work counsultant and school counsellor. Within my different roles as a social worker I have developed the ability to solve complex problems, be problem-solving oriented, have the skills needed to analyse big amounts of data. I have learnt the importance of being flexible, cooperative and enterprising in various contexts.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
